name: Kepler-354
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-354 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-354 is a star with 0.57 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.67 times its radius. It is located 1836.13 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-354 is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-354 b

Kepler-354 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.48 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-354.

The mass of Kepler-354 b is 4.15 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-354 b is 1.84 that of Earth. At 4.15 Earth masses, Kepler-354 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-354 c

Kepler-354 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.12 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 16.93 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-354.

The mass of Kepler-354 c is 1.84 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-354 c is 1.31 that of Earth. At 1.84 Earth masses, Kepler-354 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-354 d

Kepler-354 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.15 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 24.21 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-354.

The mass of Kepler-354 d is 1.63 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-354 d is 1.24 that of Earth. At 1.63 Earth masses, Kepler-354 d is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-354, which contains 3 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
